newsitem.title: USA: BPA power prices mostly unchanged for Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: BPA power prices mostly unchanged for Wednesday.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) left offer prices for firm and non-firm power on Wednesday nearly unchanged from the previous day, the agency said Tuesday.
BPA offered up to 500 MW of firm, peak power for Wednesday at $13.00 per MWh for Northwest deliveries and $14.00 for California-Oregon border (COB) sales, unchanged from Tuesday.
Wednesday firm off-peak prices were also unchanged at $10.50 per MWh for all deliveries.
Up to 500 MW of non-firm power for hours ending 0800-1000 and 1800-2000 PST on Wednesday was offered at $15.50 (Northwest) and $16.50 (COB), up 50 cents from Tuesday prices.
Non-firm power prices during shoulder hours (0700, 1100-1700 and 2100-2200) were unchanged at $13.00 (Northwest) and $14.00 (COB).
Non-firm power during off-peak hours on Wednesday was offered at $10.50 for all deliveries.
BPA also offered displacement power during off-peak hours on Wednesday at $7.00 and $9.00 per MWh.
